alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 10:04AM EDT until April 15 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Marquette MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... Chocolay River near Harvey affecting Marquette County. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING TO SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chocolay River near Harvey. * WHEN...From Thursday morning to Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Water inundates the entire parking lot at the M-28 bridge...and the fishing pier begins to be submerged. Water inundates low lying areas along Timber Lane and Riverside Road downstream of the river gauge site * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:33 AM EDT WEDNESDAY the stage was 8.74 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 10.1 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Friday evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.1 feet on 04/16/2002. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 215 AM EDT.
